{{also|Jetzt}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|de|itz|itzt|itzo|itzund|jetzo}} {{qualifier|archaic, regional, or obsolete}} * {{alter|de|jez|jetz}} {{qualifier|internet and text-message slang}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|iez}}, {{m|gmh|ieze}}, {{m|gmh|iezū}}, {{m|gmh|iezō}}, {{m|gmh|iezuo}}, from {{inh|de|goh|iozuo|t=straightaway, at once; further}}, equivalent to {{compound|de|je|zu|nocat=1}}. Compare {{cog|en|yet}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/jɛtst/}} {{qualifier|official standard}} * {{IPA|de|/jɛts/}} {{qualifier|usually before a consonant; colloquially in all positions}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-jetzt.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-jetzt.ogg}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[now]] {{gloss|at the moment, in the present}} #: ''Ich bin '''jetzt''' da.'' – I’m here '''now.''' #: '''''Jetzt''' gibt es sowas gar nicht mehr.'' #:: Such things don’t exist anymore '''now.''' # [[now]], [[then]] ({{non-gloss definition|expressing a logical or temporal consequence}}) #: ''Wir haben abgewaschen, '''jetzt''' müssen wir noch abtrocknen.'' #:: We've washed up, '''now''' we must dry [the dishes]. #: ''Was bedeuten '''jetzt''' die geschilderten Entwicklungen für unser Land?'' #:: '''Now''' what do the aforementioned developments mean for our country? # [[now]] ({{non-gloss definition|unstressed and expletive, used for minor emphasis}}) #: ''Was soll das '''jetzt''' heißen?'' #:: What's that supposed to mean '''now'''? ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|expressing a consequence}} {{l|de|nun}} * {{sense|used for minor emphasis}} {{l|de|nun}}
